traer.physics
Class Particle

java.lang.Object
  traer.physics.Particle
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChargedParticle
public class Particle
extends java.lang.Object

A Class for representing a Particle; contains the Particle's position, velocity, and the force on the Particle as Vector3Ds. The Particle also has a mass, and a fixed vs free state.

Author:
Jeffrey Traer Bernstein, Carl Pearson

Constructor Detail

Particle

public Particle(float m)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Create a Particle with mass m.

For developers: delegates to setMass(float).

Parameters:
m - the desired mass; may not be <= 0
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - via setMass(float) if m<=0

Particle

public Particle()
Constructor for a Particle with DEFAULT_MASS.

For Developers: delegates to Particle(float) with argument DEFAULT_MASS.

Method Detail

distanceTo

public final float distanceTo(Particle p)
                       throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Calculates the distance between this Particle and another.

Parameters:
p - the other Particle
Returns:
the distance between the two Particles
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if p == null

makeFixed

public final Particle makeFixed()
Fixes the Particle. Delegates to setFixed(boolean) with a true argument.

Returns:
this Particle, modified

makeFree

public final Particle makeFree()
Frees the Particle. Delegates to setFixed(boolean) with a false argument.

Returns:
this Particle, modified

setFixed

public final Particle setFixed(boolean fixed)
Sets the Particles fixity state to fixed. Has the side-effect of clearing the velocity if fixed==true.

Parameters:
fixed - the new fixity state
Returns:
this Particle modified

isFixed

public final boolean isFixed()
Get the fixed state - returns true if the Particle is fixed, false if not

Returns:
the fixed state

isFree

public final boolean isFree()
Get the free state - returns false if the Particle is fixed, true if not. Essentially, !isFixed().

Returns:
the fixed state

position

public final Vector3D position()

velocity

public final Vector3D velocity()

mass

public final float mass()
Get the Particle mass

Returns:
the mass; always > 0

setMass

public final Particle setMass(float m)
Sets the Particle mass to m and return the Particle; m must be > 0

Parameters:
m - the new mass; must be > 0.
Returns:
this Particle, mass updated
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if m<=0

force

public final Vector3D force()
Gets the Vector3D force on the Particle. Using this to clear the force is deprecated; use clearForce() instead. Using this to add force is deprecated; use addForce(Vector3D) instead.

Returns:
the force on the Particle

addForce

public final Particle addForce(Vector3D added)
Updates the force on the Particle by adding the extra force.

Parameters:
added - the force to add to the current Particle force
Returns:
this Particle, force updated
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - via Vector3D.add(Vector3D) if added==null

clearForce

public final Particle clearForce()
Clears the force on the Particle using Vector3D.clear(), then returns the Particle.

Returns:
this Particle, updated.

age

public final float age()
Gets the age of the Particle

Returns:
the current Particle age

reset

public Particle reset()
Sets age=0, dead=false, clears the position, velocity, force Vector3Ds, and mass = DEFAULT_MASS.

Returns:
the reset Particle
